com.sayem.appium.pagefactory.framework.browser

Class RemoteBrowserBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sayem.appium.pagefactory.framework.browser.RemoteBrowserBuilder

  • public class RemoteBrowserBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

    Builder class for creating a RemoteBrowser. A RemoteBrowser is a browser running in a Selenium Grid, that works by connecting to a Selenium Hub. See https://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/Grid2

    In other words, a RemoteBrowser is a wrapper around a RemoteWebDriver that simplifies configuration and unifies options across all Browsers.

    You can call getBuilder(WebBrowserType, String, String) to get a builder, or you can equivalently call getChromeBuilder(String, String), getFirefoxBuilder(String, String), or getInternetExplorerBuilder(String, String). Calling RemoteBrowserBuilder.getBuilder(BrowserType.CHROME, ...) is equivalent to calling RemoteBrowserBuilder.getChromeBuilder(...).

      • getBuilder

        public static RemoteBrowserBuilder getBuilder(WebBrowserType browserType,
                                              java.lang.String baseTestUrl,
                                              java.lang.String seleniumHubURL)
        Get a RemoteBrowserBuilder used to construct a RemoteBrowser instance that helps you to run Selenium tests against a remote Browser running in a Selenium Grid.
        Parameters:
        browserType - - CHROME, FIREFOX, or IE
        baseTestUrl - - base URL of the webapp you are testing, e.g. http://my.site.com/base
        seleniumHubURL - - URL with port to the Selenium HUB, e.g. http://selenium.my.company.com:4444/wd/hub

      • getChromeBuilder

        public static RemoteBrowserBuilder getChromeBuilder(java.lang.String baseTestUrl,
                                                    java.lang.String seleniumHubURL)
        Get a RemoteBrowserBuilder used to construct a RemoteBrowser instance that helps you to run Selenium tests against a remote Browser running in a Selenium Grid. For CHROME browser.
        Parameters:
        baseTestUrl - - base URL of the webapp you are testing, e.g. http://my.site.com/base
        seleniumHubURL - - URL with port to the Selenium HUB, e.g. http://selenium.my.company.com:4444/wd/hub
